Laying up crowns in heaven... sharing the love you have been given with the little ones. I'll be supporting you in prayers my friend! May the Lord continue to bless all the work of your hands, as you reach out to help those who can't help themselves!

It's a shame some people don't see the benefit of both of your missions. They think that because you are motivated to do these things out of your love for Christ, that this is somehow "forcing your religion" on the children. Nobody can force anybody to accept love or salvation... it's always a personal decision that everyone has to make... to simply (a) accept the love of God as shown through what Christ fully accomplished for us, or to (b) reject that love and the promises that go with it.

We're all responsible for our own decisions... one way or the other.

It's someone holding out a gift and offering it to you... saying "here it is, I can't force you to accept it, it's up to you to grasp it, open it, and enjoy what's inside". 

If we explain to the little ones what's inside the "gift", it gives them the information needed to make a well-informed decision when the time comes... but it's still their decision... and your decision... take it or leave it.

No other "spiritual leader" ever made this claim "I am THE truth, THE way, and THE life... no one comes to the Father but through me".  Only one.

After reading people saying that they are conflicted because Not Forgotten uses Christianity and a wholehearted belief in Christ as a message, I was compelled to say THANK YOU!  Many of these people seem to misunderstand what faith in Christ seems to be about.  Yes, you should keep on spreading the news of Jesus across Peru, there are many that need to hear his message!  I am in a bit of a financial bind right now, but I will be enlisting in the Navy here pretty soon and I will gladly donate to a cause that uses the Word of God as a message!  Science is all fine and dandy, but it was God that allowed us the ability to make our own choices, it is up to us on how we use that power.  Many people seem to think that God is Anti-Science, or Vice Versa,  or in other words that you can't love science and be a true God-fearing man.  WRONG, science helps us understand things that we previously could not, however as we discover all these new things we should praise God and thank him for creating such a wonderful earth, where this science is even possible.

The next argument will be that if God was real, then why does all the bad things (human trafficking in Peru for example) keep happening?  Good question, once again it all boils down to choice.  God gave everyone a choice, he gave Satan free will, and that caused him to try and overthrow God himself.  Evil exists because God gave everyone free will, we can do as we please while we are here on this earth, but it is when we are gone from this earth that we will have to pay the price when you don't believe, or collect the rewards for our faith here on earth. 

So keep on spreading the word!  Let it be the backbone of your message, and let it be what drives you!  God is good and will definitely reward you for spreading his word, and living life the way that he wanted us to, by helping each other.  Pray for those that need prayer, help those that need help, and those that think they don't need prayer, well they need it the most!  Prove that Christians aren't bigots, we aren't homophobic, we aren't hypocritical.  There may be a few like that out there, but the majority of TRUE Christians would never judge a person and would just love them like Christ loves us.

Amen and you guys are in my prayers!

Although I absolutely want these kids out of harms way, as others have mentioned I do feel weird about donating to a Christian organization.  Even if your desire to donate or create charity organizations is motivated by your faith, I think it's best to keep the organizations themselves secular but welcoming to religious volunteers.  That way you don't alienate people of other faiths or non-believers.  

With a quick search online I found an organization called Not For Sale that also helps in Peru and a lot of other countries.  Though they have some religious elements (according to Wikipedia a church network for people of Christian, Jewish, and Muslim faiths), overall it's a secular organization.  I didn't do much research beyond that though.  If you know a good secular or multi-faith organization that helps with the problems in Peru or elsewhere, please post it here!

House dust mites, due to their very small size and translucent bodies, are barely visible to the unaided eye. A typical house dust mite measures 0.25–0.3 millimetres (0.010–0.012 in) in length. For accurate identification, one needs at least 10× magnification. The body of the house dust mite has a striated cuticle.

I'm from Peru and I've been there. I'm grateful that Iquitos was chosen, I encourage you to vote and help them. Iquitos is a wonderful place but could be better, and not only that place. Iquitos is the central part of Loreto(therefore it is a little bit more "developed"), but there are more places that need help, there is a community called San Antonio in Nauta and people from there told me that most of the year these kids don't go to school because there are NO TEACHERS. There is a lot to do. And this could be the start for making a better place for the people who don't really have much.

After seeing all the anti-faith comments, I am saddened to see so many who seem to believe that faith and science are opposites. Science is simply the pursuit to understand how things work, and our knowledge of how things work has been constantly changing since man first asked "what's this?". Many famous scientists of the past have had faith in God, and there's nothing contradictory about that. My faith in Jesus Christ does not require me to leave my brain at the door, but is a reasonable faith built on a combination of logic, awareness, scripture and trust. I love what Destin is doing here, and wish more people would come to understand that the pursuit of knowledge (science) and faith in God are absolutely compatible.

This is a serious waste of money. People have been trying to help these countries for years and shell out millions of dollars that eventually end up as a pile of rubble because they refuse to help themselves.

I'm completely against foreign aid for the sole reason that they won't help themselves and expect the rest of the world to help them instead. To get help from others, you need to help yourselves first.

I can't remember exactly where it happened but many years ago farming equipment was sent to a continent in Africa as part of foreign aid and it ended up rusting away on the docks. That was nothing but an utter waste of money that could of been spent on American families that are homeless or sexually exploited children in America(Get your head out of the sand if you think this doesn't happen in America)

I really do hope you do a follow up video 5 years from now showing us the rubble that once was an orphanage for Peruvian children.

Try to help your neighbor before you try to help helpless backwater countries that are never going to change. I guess nobody noticed all the foreign aid advertisements on television have practically been removed because people are waking up to how worthless it is to try and help those who won't help themselves.

You got a good heart, but it's in the complete wrong place. I will simply not support this project at all. Good day.

Just in case you do not see the inbox... Here is a message I sent you....
"Hey, I just saw your recent video about the children's home and donations and what not and wanted to do more than just donate a couple bucks. 

I am not very big on Youtube. I currently have just under 5k subs so I am not sure how much I can do in the way of getting the word out compared to your 2 million subs, but I want to do what I can. 

I make gaming videos and I am going to dedicate my next video to talking about your project and then host a link to your video as well as a link to where people can donate in the description box. 

Like I said, I am not as well known as you or others, but I want to do what I can to help and I think what you are doing is a worthy cause. 

My next video should be up with in a couple of days, if not sooner."

As a peruvian I'm very happy about this, but at the same time I'm sad. We have to wait until people from other countries come and help us, and don't get me wrong, that's totally fine, but my point is that our people (Peruvians) care less to none when it comes to help each other. My country is a capital-centered country, all and goes around Lima and just Lima and I think that's not fair for all the people living here. It got to the point where the people who aren't from Lima (example: from Arequipa) starts to hate you when you travel and they ask you: "Where are you from? -Oh I'm from Lima". The goverment is full is people who only seeks the power over the others and make bad decisions just to get money. So having said that, I'm very happy that people from other countries, not only the U.S cares about the situation of Perú. I'm sure that if we all work together we can make things better and start building a much better country. Thanks guys!

P.D: Sry if I have some mistakes, Spanish is my native language. (+1 to this post if you want the people to know the real situation)

Mainly revolving from this mission statement  "Not Forgotten invites you to join us in spreading the hope of Jesus Christ to these children, that they might find true life in Him."
